metadata.title: CVE-2021-3746 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the libtpms code that may cause access beyond theboundary of internal buffers. The vulnerability is triggered byspecially-crafted TPM2 command packets that then trigger the issue when thestate of the TPM2's volatile state is written. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to system availability. This issue affects libtpmsversions before 0.8.5, before 0.7.9 and before 0.6.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3746` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtpms0 - 0.9.3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libtpms package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.3-0ubuntu1').
